CONJUGATES: n: belly | bellies (pl); v: belly | bellying | bellied | bellies
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'beli' (bag, belly), from Proto-Germanic '*balgiz' (bag, bellows). Cognate with 'bellows'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The front part of the human or animal body below the chest, containing the digestive organs; the abdomen.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 人或动物身体中胸部以下、包含消化器官的前部；腹部。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He rubbed his dog's belly affectionately.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他亲昵地抚摸着狗的肚子。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The rounded underside or bulging part of something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某物的圆形底部或鼓起的部分。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The belly of the ship was filled with cargo.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Verb: a word used to describe an action, state, or occurrence, and forming the main part of the predicate of a sentence.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To swell or cause to swell out; to bulge.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The sails bellied out in the strong wind.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 风帆在强风中鼓了起来。

REGISTER: Common usage; generally informal when referring to the human abdomen (unless used in specific contexts like 'belly laugh'), but standard for animals, objects, or as a verb.
